intro: Hymenopappus eriopodus, commonly known as the woolly sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive bracts. The plant produces showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically gray-green with a dense layer of fine hairs, providing a unique texture. Hymenopappus eriopodus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
